data.text: I installed Instabridge just to check it out. First time trying to use it and all I had was a list of "rarely works" Wi-Fi options. I wish I could get back the time it took me to install the app and now delete the app. I could have spent that 4 minutes, watching some senseless YouTube video and felt better about the lost time.

Instabridge,is by far the best app for hooking onto and into any wifi so you can get on line when it counts the most, not to mention the stability is awesome the other apps I have tried don't even come close in comparison. delete all the other apps that claim connection to wifi and map it out , cause this app will be the only app you will ever need.

This app takes a ridiculous amount of real estate and changes the appearance of the home screen and has way too many ads. I can't even tell you if even works or how well. I couldn't past the initial setup and install becuz it's so invasive and has such a crude appearance! It literary just takes over your device. Free or not I would never recommend this to anyone, besides don't bother wasting your time. I usually don't give 1 star reviews. But in this case I felt a obligation to warn you!

Absolutely awful! It completely took over my phone, rearranged EVERYTHING. Constant ads everywhere. When you really look at the permissions, you see that this app has now become the system your phone works on and everything that that entails. Oh yeah, it also downloads apps and files... Without your authorization of course. And you have to do some research to uninstall it, because that feature is also not available. NO!!!!

This app ruins my phone and wouldn't let me delete it, I did not really commend you downloading it, and it damages the Wi-Fi in the places you're at, I download it, and this is happened, I really don't recommend it, and you will get in trouble for it in that place, and it completely changes your phone, iPad, whatever you using, and you can slide and ads will pop up. When you're trying to open your phone, don't download it. Really don't recommend. This will ruinwhatever you're using!
data.replyText: Hi. We apologize for the trouble. Please email support@instabridge.com and tell us about the encountered issue so we can investigate and improve the app. Any information you can share will be very helpful. Please uninstall the app via the Google Play Store. Regards, The Instabridge Support Team

data.text: I would rate this less than one star, but that is not possible, I completely takes over your browser and it adds files, downloads, apps without your permission, and it will completely take over your phone and I'll give you ads randomly when you on your homescreen and it randomly pops up with stuff on your home screen. It pops up with a whole lot of Internet stuff and if you try to click on the Internet it doesn't really work because it tells you to get a password and permission from the owner

Installed it for the first time but if you set the app as default browser it completely takes over your phone and if you tap to find a password it takes you to an ad that you get rid of , so frustrating so needless to say I uninstalled it in the first 5 or 10 mins . It could be a great but it needs to be revamped and less ads and a way to get rid of the ads when one pops up.

I'm trying to build a WiFi phone to leave in the car. Something that, if I forget my phone or it's disabled for some reason, I can pull into a parking lot, find a hotspot, and make a call or send a text. And this exposes the glaring defect in Instabridge (and the many other WiFi finding apps that I've tried). They don't work without a data connection. When I say "work", I mean they do function somewhat, but not enough to be useful. For example, you can download a list of WiFi hotspots in your area. But, you can't browse them or look at them on a map unless you are online. The app does show you a short list of hotspots in your area that you can connect to for free, but unless you are online, it only shows what's in range of your WiFi, which is like finding a needle in a haystack. It'd be nice to show you, while OFFLINE, which WiFi hotspots were in your immediate area, even if your device couldn't detect them at the time, so you can drive or walk to them and connect. Worse, I couldn't get the list to refresh without restarting the app. I drove to the next town 3 miles over and the short list of hotspots from the town I'd just left was still displayed on the main screen, and it was still trying to connect to them. Which in some sense defeats the purpose. If you don't have data, you need this app to find a data connection, but it doesn't work without a data connection. So, it's probably great if you have really limited data, but enough to run the app. Outside of that, I don't understand the appeal.

The app plots WiFi locations, but nearly all of them are locked down. Of the open locations, most either don't work (if you dig for more info), or haven't been used in a long time. The only working WiFi I found was through trial and error, on my own. This app may be useful in Europe as it appears the primary user base is there, but in the US, it's worthless.

Seriously!! Don't waste your time and data with this app. You'll get no WiFi usage by collecting points. And every single "On the network WiFi", not a single one worked they just want you to install the WiFi link. I went through 64 links and had 6000 points and all they offered was a cloud storage and their, "Log activity" VPN SERVICE. And if you don't have a paid account, can't do 💩 on their WiFi.. Trash

Disappointing & useless application. I have given this app a shot on three occasions when I didn't have a data plan to rely on. Tons of notifications and no results. Of the few passwords that might be plugged in mostar out of date. it never ever actually comes through with getting you on a Wi-Fi that you wouldn't have been able to otherwise. Don't bother.

I was under the impression that the app would somehow provide internet connection... Only if you set it up for it! It does not give you internet capabilities without paying for data and the ads are set up to where you can't hardly tell if they are for the app or not! If you don't mind paying extra it would probably work fine. My circumstances are that I don't have extra money. Great idea needs more people to participate but no free WiFi here

Connects to many WiFi sources that I didn't expect, many with passwords that I don't normally have access to, even if it is a business I frequent (I never bothered to ask for the password usually). In fact, it connects so well that I have to shut off my WiFi when driving in the city or it connects to public WiFi at nearby businesses at every stoplight! The constant notification tones whenever it connects are annoying, but they can be turned off by sliding the notification tab slightly right and going into the settings gear button there.

Once installed it wouldn't allow me to uninstall from the apps option on my phone I had to physically go back into the Play store to uninstall it! And It didn't have any of the nearby Wi-Fi's let alone any passwords to open them up I think you have to be in major cities in metropolitan areas so can't use this app! so if in rural areas you most likely won't be able 2 use it

Wifi portion never works, ever aspect of it is inaccurate. The app itself is extremely invasive; installs all types of widgets and changes the layout of your phone's apps and app drawer. And I still can't uninstall it. And ads are built into the app itself since they run even without internet connection. Stay away at all costs. Update: After everything and getting nowhere, I was finally able to uninstall this adware, you have to uninstall through the Google play store; any other will not work.
data.replyText:
Hi. Our apologies for the inconvenience it caused. Instabridge is a WiFi sharing app. The availability of correct passwords would depend on how many people and establishments want to share their WiFi networks. If you've opened Instabridge via Google Play you should have the uninstall button. email: support@degoo.com
Instabridge Team

data.text: First off, if you're not a fan of ads, don't download. All this app basically does is act as a VPN, internet browser, and WiFi finder all in one, however if you want this to actually work well, it costs money. This app doesn't connect to WiFi's automatically, it just shows you where good WiFi spots are and give you directions to them. This app will unlock the passwords of WiFi's with weak security, because my at home WiFi's password is pretty secure and it never popped up in the list. Okay app

I'm not sure if it's because of my phone (Moto G6) but, this app doesn't work for me at all. It only shows my home wifi, so whenever I go out somewhere and I'm trying to find wifi connections nearby, it doesn't show any that are actually near me at all. There's also an option to scan for wifi connections but it never works, it just says there's none near me. This app was a waste of time and storage.

Sometimes works. However, alot of the nearby Wi-Fi's, they always state that they 'rarely' are successful in connecting... Could be better, and with time and more downloads and participation, I'm sure it will be. But currently, all-in-all,... I'd say it's alittle above average in functionality and performance. Thanx again...

I like that App (not quite Love). Why, because it works. A lot of times you download these Hotspot Apps, you turn them on and nothing happens, or the passwords are incorrect. This App is sometimes unreliable only because the information is sometimes incorrect. Ofwhich you can quickly remedy, especially if you have data, or limited data by going into the app itself and updating the information. There are tsp-ons for that :). You can aslo send emails to update info. I recommend this App!

It's good for seeing networks around you with an estimated time to walk or drive to the network you wanna connect to you choose! So as far as I see it this app is extremely informative and I'm happy to have found it! Check it out! I think you will agree! Oh yeah it does lead you to open networks that comes in handy saves you time and it's worth the download!

I needed access to WiFi. I have a phone with hotspot but it's a pain since it doesn't work very well. Like everyone else I'm busy as you can be. This app helped me to stay online to complete things I couldn't get done with my other phone. 5 Stars! I am able to get things done. The paid services in my area are not very good and expensive for what you get (not always available either!). I don't have to search as much for WiFi.

Like many apps, this one had it's share of ups and downs especially with receiving and keeping a signal. But the connectivity and maintaining the signal has definitely improved and I think with the fast moving technology advances this app will only continue to get better. Worth checking out for sure...👀🌐

Shows wifi that can be used near you. Its in a list with name, amount of time to reach there and chances of getting a good connection. Block im at specifficly only has one open network right next to me and rarely connects which i seen it specifies most likely wont connect which it doesnt. But the list shows me where theres better options close by ranging from a 2 to 8 min walk. They ask can theyvshow ads to keep app free and not force it. Good app. No lag. Fast loading. Great job on this app.

I couldn't get this app to work at all for me. They make it seem like anyone can connect and get free wifi but that's just not true. There has to be someone in your area that's also connected to the app because the one's I saw in my area that had open accounts hadn't submitted any wifi's to the app. Plus, they really didn't offer very much support even on their website. Needless to say, it was all very decieving and disappointing. They didn't even deserve the one star rating that I gave them.

Worked great til it didn't . For some reason it blocks half of the sites I use on a regular basis when I'm connected to a WiFi. It's pretty annoying considering it worked just great when I first got it. Customer support sucks too. I've tried contacting them twice and both times I get a very rude response telling me to contact someone else .

Scam. Do not download this. You have to watch ads to get a password(Which rarely works AT ALL!!!). Also, it has to change your home screen, browser, and it has to add stuff just so it can work. If you already downloaded it that's okay, just delete the app and it's back to normal.But, anyways, don't download this it is a waste of time and is like a virus.

Complete garbage. I can't connect to any of the wifi's that are available. It says copy password, then I go to my list of wifi available and that one isn't listed, so when I try to add it, it doesn't add it .It's not helping me at all & just keeps making my phone crash. Just like the so called "wifi boosters", this is another FAKE APP that I wasted my time with. I'm so sick of these BS apps getting my hopes up that they work. Stop paying ppl to write good reviews bc NONE of these apps HELP!!!!
data.replyText: Instabridge is a WiFi sharing app. You can only connect to WiFi hotspots that have been shared. You have to be close enough to an available hotspot, and it has to be active (the green ones usually are). The "Add" button is a way to share you own WiFi password to the app. It will not connect you to that WiFi network.

data.text: I have been able to add wifi passwords in the past with no issues up until now, all of the sudden I keep getting an error message saying that the password I have entered is incorrect... How would this app even know if the password is correct or not when the network hasn't even been added to instabrodge yet‽ How could the password be incorrect if I just used the same exact password to connect to this network‽ CAN'T FIX STUPID!

Amazingly, this application is an internet browser, VPN provider, and launcher! Its GUI is generally fine, but contains a lot of advertisements. I'm obviously not going to set it as my default browser or launcher, so it shouldn't ask more than once. Does display local Wi-Fi networks impressively enough, but the constant full-screen advertisements make it useless.

Instabridge is okay with connecting me to free wifi as well as my home wifi. However, I'm not crazy about using it as a launcher. Apps are hidden behind a screen and not easily accessible. Furthermore, the launcher interferes with my wallpaper app leaving me with plain old phone assigned wallpapers. If there was a way for me use Instabridge just for the wifi and nothing else I would be a very happy camper.

So far I have tested the app it seems to be working. But on the other hand I made sure to check to see if it was compatible to my phone and my tablet and any other devices that are synced with your product app. Also you guys need to stop presenting ads on your app. At times it could be a bit annoying.

To begin with I thought this was a really good app but then I noticed several things were changed on my home, 4 different app widgets were put on my home screen, the general setup and layout of my home screen had been changed and this had happened without me giving consent or allowing the app permission to change or add these. It does not matter what the specific reason is why the app did this WITHOUT MY PERMISSION, but ANY device that has this app,NOTHING should be changed without permission ‼️

doesn't work, then you can't delete it from your phone you go to uninstall and it's grayed out so you can't click it . I think they are stealing information. why can't it delete off my phone? Also, I have WiFi at home and when I'm on it that's when it decides to scan and knocks me off my wifi I haven't been able to connect to ANY WiFi outside of home!

Bad app. The app tells me to set is a default launcher and after I did my home screen looked very bad. I never used the app because it doesn't actually show the WiFi's around me. At least it has VPN...

I don't think it's right that I have to pay for Google Play pay every month just to get these other benefits or whatever I'm trying to get done. and and why does this Google one storage have a small fee every month?0 I mean you're charging me to have it to keep it to use it. why I haven't even used all my gigabytes yet so why am I being charged again? Not everybody can pay annually to save in the long run. so I run the risk of having my money taken off my card when it's unlocked it's shady

DumB and DumBeR! Guys do you really think you will get free internet connection? 😂 Kids these days don't even know there is a mobile data connection and they thought only connecting through a WiFi router gives internet. 😂 Even if you can crack some WiFi connections, it will come from a fake router made by this dumb app. 😂
